The pleasures of love and marriage a poem in praise of the fair sex, in requital for The folly of love, and some other late satyrs on women. Ames, Richard, d. 1693.
[5], 18 [i.e. 26] p.
Printed for H.N. and are to be sold by R. Baldwin ..., London : 1691.
Attributed to Richard Ames. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Reproduction of original in Harvard University Libraries.
